byline.original: By PETER BAKER and MARC SANTORA

abstract: Pres Obama arrives in Kenya, country where his father was born, for start of four-day tour through East Africa; trip, which will include visit to Ethiopia, holds deep personal significance for Obama, who will also address geopolitical issues of democracy, human rights and continued fight against terrorism.
lead_paragraph: President Obama emphasized his ties to Kenya, the land of his father, shortly after arriving when he dined with members of his extended family.

headline.main: Obama Arrives in Kenya, on Personal and Official Journey
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Visit Starts on a Personal Note, Emphasizing Family Ties to Kenya

snippet: President Obama emphasized his ties to Kenya, the land of his father, shortly after arriving when he dined with members of his extended family.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
